result.execSummary:
The defendant James Arthur Nickence was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: This judgment is for fines, court costs and restitution that you were ordered to pay through Dept of Corrections - if not paid during probation - or you get revoked  and have not paid in full - you will be required to pay to the Clerk of Courts any unpaid amount plus interest.

supervisions.notes:
Sentence is withheld and DEF is placed on probation for 1 year.  Conditions of probation: $579 fine/costs; No Contact with James Leek;  Absolute Sobriety  No drug use without a valid prescription.
DEF to report to DOC today.

miscConds.notes: $379.00 fine.    If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

$200 DNA surcharge.    If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Absolute Sobriety  No drug use without a valid prescription.

judgments.dispoDesc:
State moves to Amend Ct #1 to Misd Battery.  Court approves.  DEF pleads No Contest to amended charge, found Guilty.  Sentence is withheld and DEF is placed on probation for 1 year.  Conditions of probation: $579 fine/costs; No Contact with James Leek;  Absolute Sobriety  No drug use without a valid prescription.
DEF to report to DOC today.
